course.subject: COMP
course.name: Image Processing
course.description: Introduction to image processing. Topics include image processing and analysis in spatial and frequency domains, image restoration and compression, image segmentation and registration, morphological image processing, representation and description, object recognition, related application areas and some other closely related topics. Some sophisticated image processing and analysis tools and state-of-the-art methods may also be introduced subject to the availability of time.
course.prerequisites: (COMP 2011 OR COMP 2012 OR COMP 2012H) AND (MATH 2011 OR MATH 2111 OR MATH 2350 OR MATH 2351 OR MATH 2352)
course.exclusions: ELEC 4130, MATH 4336

reviews.author: Tommy Li
reviews.title: Old-school Interesting Content Taught by A Nice Professor
reviews.comment_content:
This course is mainly about standard techniques in image processing. I quite like the syllabus of the course. It covered stuff from a wide range of difficulty and some of the methods introduced is quite interesting. For example, you can segment an image with a lazy snake that tries to minimize his energy level!

List of Topics:
Topic 1: Image representation, MATLAB programming
Topic 2: Spatial domain image enhancement
Topic 3: Frequency domain image enhancement
Topic 4: Image restoration and filtering, Non-linear filtering
Topic 5: Morphological image processing
Topic 6: Image segmentation
Topic 7: Image registration
Topic 8: Image compression
Topic 9: Face detection and recognition
Topic 10: Feature descriptors

Don't get confused by the segmentation/object detection/face recognition part. This course focused on more traditional image processing based methods instead of state-of-the-art deep learning stuff. Although some of the stuff may seemed old-fashioned, they are still being widely used as of today.

Some of the research topic by the professor was also included. Nevertheless, the exam only focused on the standard stuff so you don't need to worry too much.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I don't know why but I like the professor's voice lol. Anyway, I think he did a good job in teaching. He tried to explain the slides with annotations and drawings which should not be too difficult to catch up for most students. However, he did speed up a bit in the late half of the semester so you may want to rewatch the video if you miss some of the points.

The professor did answer the question asked in class. He also don't mind to explain something again if we got confused on the concept. Overall, he is a nice prof. that explains things clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading seems quite nice from the statistics although I need more data to judge that confidently. If I assume the SD is similar to a normal COMP course exam (18~20), I would be ~1-1.2 SD above mean, which normally would be an A- or A. And, the highest score is 97 which suggests high score should be possible (not for most people tho :C). I am quite surprised to get an A+. Also, my friend got B+ with 0.5 SD above mean (with the same assumption) so it should be slightly better grading than average.

I didn't check my exam paper. But, I don't have enough time to finish the last question on AdaBoost (a standard question appeared in the assignment) and that question worth 13 points. I would say if you are not too careless, a good grade should be possible.

Grade breakdown and statistics:
Assignment 1: 100/100 (Mean: 86.6)
Assignment 2: 100/100 (Mean: 80.7)
Assignment 3: 100/100 (Mean: 82.4)
Assignment Total (40%): 40/40
Exam (60%): 84/100 (Mean: 64.6, High: 97)
Overall: 90.4% => A+

My friend: Assignment 3 deduct ~10 point + exam 73.5 => B+

Note: The weighting between 3 assignments are uneven but the exact weighting was not announced. The professor said it should be about (10%, 15%, 15%) at the start of the semester.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are total of three assignments. The assignments are not easy. You may need some time to do experiments and think deeper on how to implement the algorithm. (Simple loops will be too slow!) As the implementation is not that straight forward, there might be unexpected issues coming up. Do reserve two or three days for each of the assignments.

No past papers were given. However, do spend some time to try out (and maybe speedrun) the examples given in lectures. It is especially important in this online setting as most will got his/her pace slowed down in online exams. Try to be conservative in time management too as you cannot go back to the previous question. In fact, I got shocked when the AdaBoost (a standard but long question, pure computation) question comes up as the last question.

reviews.author: Aye
reviews.title: Image processing
reviews.comment_teaching: Good pronunciation. Topics are quite interesting and not very difficult. Some extensions were introduced although some of them are not required in exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
Average.

30% Assignments (each assignment consists of written part and programming part, of which programming part is a little harder) + 70% Exams

Exams were kind of easy.
Midterm: mean 72.1,   SD 19.3.
Final:      mean 70.07, SD 22.

100% assignments + 91% midterm + 76% final => B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Although there are lots of formulas in the notes, you do not really need to memorize them. Most of them are provided in exams. But be sure to get hold of how to use them.
If you want to learn more about computer vision, better take COMP5421. 2/3 people received A+ this semester. And the contents are really useful and challenging.

Some students took COMP4421 and COMP5421 together this semester.

reviews.author: The_Unknown
reviews.title: Little room for error due to high median
reviews.comment_content:
A standard introduction to image processing techniques.

Frankly speaking, the course is like an overview on the techniques related to image processing. So, it is easier than a typical level 4 elective. That is also why it has an extremely high mean/median score.

However, if we are to consider the number of chapters in the course and the semester duration, I would say that the content is rather appropriate.

Chapters include the following:

Introduction
Image Fundamentals
Image Transformations
Image Filtering
Image Restoration
Image Compression
Morphological Image Processing
Image Segmentation
Image Registration
Feature Extraction
Image Recognition and Deep Learning
Advanced Topics in Medical Image Processing
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Chen speaks rather fast, so it is a bit hard to follow when in the lecture room, since notes are released just a day early.
But luckily, lectures videos are present in canvas. Once you read  the notes and watch the videos, it is easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
The mean/median of this course is high, like really high for assignments and midterms. So you need to be careful about your answers.

This is especially true for assignments where some questions are kinda out of lecture scope. To be fair, they do provide hints for questions like that.

Finals, on the other hand, provide more flexibility since mean/median is more "typical".

To break it down:
Assignment 1 (10%): Median 94, High 100
Assignment 2 (10%): Median 100, High 100
Assignment 3 (10%): Median 100, High 100
Midterm (30%): Median 82, High 100
Final Exam (40%): Median 75, High 97

My weighted overall is around 95, which translates to an A+.

Some questions in exam relate to details mentioned in small font/images (like the phase angle) and are easy to be missed. So, do remember to clearly look at the images and their labels because they may be asked in exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
The only workload comes from the assignment, which should take about two hours or three if you are unfamiliar with the lecture notes and less if you are familiar.
Given that each assignment has just 4-5 questions, I would say the workload is appropriate.

That said, you will likely need to study the lecture notes in depth.

reviews.author: DrainGang
reviews.title: Decent
reviews.comment_content:
Basic introduction image processing, including spatial domain, frequency domain, image restoration and filtering, morphological image processing, image segmentation, image registration, image compression,  face recognition, etc.

All very practical and is generally interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Decent.

Heavy accent however he is very enthusiastic about the lecture contents, so therefore the lectures were not too bad, however he still repeats off the powerpoint quite a lot, and since attendance is not counted a lot of people ended up skipping.

Tutorials go over using MATLAB for image processing, however the homework and exams do not cover the contents this semester, so only attend if you are interested.
reviews.comment_grading:
Acceptable for COMP standards.

30% Midterm: Questions that are basically the same as ones seen in assignments, however it is easy to make careless mistakes, so be careful! Averages are very high (79/100)

40% Final: Exactly the same as the midterm, all based on assignments and therefore averages are again very high (73.5/100)

30% Assignments: 3 assignments, each worth 10%, most questions can be answered by looking into the lecture notes, and for those that cannot, answers can be found on the internet, averages are almost full mark on all 3.

The complex math shown in the lectures ended up being very basic and easy calculations, so this course is more about being careful and studying the assignments.

0.5% less than mean overall, B-, as expected.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite low for a 4000 level course.

Assignments are very easy and takes less than a day to complete, and for the exams since none of the tutorial content is covered and all questions are based on assignments and lecture notes, studying for the exam is also not too difficult.

reviews.author: Icespirits
reviews.title: Interesting content, enthusiastic professor but strange exam
reviews.comment_content:
如果你是希望學習關於圖像處理以及AI圖像分析的基本原理、那這個課程應該挺適合你的。
但說真的對實在對圖像處理有興趣建議去4411, 要Grade去4511, 整體內容偏理論比較少實作，大部分工作也比較少會有相關的內容，真的不算有用。

Course Syllabus:
Ch1 Intro
Ch2 Fundamentals
Ch3 Image Transformation
Ch4 Spatial Filtering
Ch5 Frequency Filtering
Ch6 Image Restoration
Ch7 Image Color Processing
Ch8 Image Compression
Ch9 Morphological Image Processing
Ch10 Image Segmentation
Ch11 Image Registration
Ch12 Feature Extraction
Ch13 Image Classification
Ch14 Advance Deep Learning in Medical Image Analysis
reviews.comment_teaching:
新來的導師挺熱情的，但是他上課比較悶，主要就是讀slide
很好的是他有把課堂的影片放到網上，可以之後再去，然後你上課問問題他也很樂意去回答
整體來說跟大部分CS的老師差不多
reviews.comment_grading:
整體分數其實不差，問題是他的整體構成以及考試的問題出得不好。

Grading Scheme:
3 Assignment 30% Mean:92~98
Midterm 30% - Mean: 78.92 Median: 82
Final 40% - Mean: 73.51 Median: 75

剩餘grading scheme寫的功課基本大家都滿分，差別不大，而差距就是在兩個考試分出來。考試模式基本都是一個半小時五題題目，每一題大概涵蓋一至兩個主題，問題他出的試卷基本上都是四題很簡單的然後一題很難的，那四題的基本也大多只是原理不涉及數學以及理解，大部分人都是被扣了一些小分數然後就是在那一題難的上面分出來，然後一題難的通常都是要你記下來堂上的某一題公式，這就導致其實這試並沒有考你對內容的理解有多少、而是一個看你到底有沒有剛好背到那條公式的幸運轉盤、所以不是太喜歡他的Grading Scheme。

但整體來說Grade其實還算不錯、個人大部分分數都是在Mean附近，B。
reviews.comment_workload: Marking scheme寫的一樣，只有考試和三份assignment，非常輕鬆。

reviews.author: HinJaiiii
reviews.title: A relatively light workload 4000-level course
reviews.comment_content:
The content is interesting. It taught some basic techniques in  image processing. The final project was either a survey project or a research project, which I chose to evaluate existing methods or to propose new methods on a problem in the research one.

Introduction to image processing. Topics include image processing and analysis in spatial and frequency domains, image restoration and compression, image segmentation and registration, morphological image processing, representation and description, object recognition, related application areas and some other closely related topics. Some sophisticated image processing and analysis tools and state-of-the-art methods may also be introduced subject to the availability of time.
reviews.comment_teaching: It was the first time the professor taught this course. The professor was passionate in delivering the course. He tried to encourage interaction in class. Also, he is a kind person and considerate to the students; at one time, he postponed the deadline the final project to provide the students more breathing time. However, he does not speak good English, which may affect how the students understand the materials.
reviews.comment_grading: The assignments and exams were a bit too easy and could not differentiate the students' grades too much. The grading of the project might have a greater impact. I did not do pretty well in the group project, even I have good scores in the exams, I received B range at the end.
reviews.comment_workload: There were a total of three assignments. The questions were straightforward, and the length is acceptable, each just took me as much as a day to finish. The mid-term and final were super EAZY. Some of the questions are just variants of the ones in the assignments. However, the group project needed some considerable amount of effort and time.

reviews.author: ckhn
reviews.title: Interesting course with good teaching and support
reviews.comment_content: This course covers some basic and interesting topic on image processing, including spatial domain, frequency domain, image restoration and filtering, morphological image processing, image segmentation, image registration, image compression,  face recognition, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Chung is an expert in this area. He can explain the concepts clearly at good pace. He is also nice and chats with students after the course. TAs are also very helpful and respond quickly to my questions on assignment, even I asked during weekend.
reviews.comment_grading: I got an excellent grading from this course I have pretty good result in the final exam but I can't finish the second assignment. So this course does not require students to be perfect.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 3 assignments and final exam. The first 2 assignments consist of many questions and some high level programming to test your concepts of image processing. The difficulty of the last assignment is tuned to be much easier as many students could barely finish the second one. I appreciate that the difficulty of assignment is adjusted according to the ability and tight of schedule.

reviews.author: Mr BIGPIG
reviews.title: Good Grade
reviews.comment_content: 關於圖像處理同埋一d 識別系統原理
reviews.comment_teaching: 教學方面唔錯~ 經常會畫圖講解 正常有留心聽都會明距講咩
reviews.comment_grading:
一般Grade  其實算唔差 因爲final exam 考得比較差 前面比較懶散~
功課方面就比較高分 avg大概B
reviews.comment_workload:
三至份assignment  每份會需要比較多時間去瞭解同實踐 因爲距一般唔準用built in function， 基本系要你寫built in function。

得Final exam 無mid term

reviews.author: ymji
reviews.title: Image processing
reviews.comment_content: Content is about filtering like Gaussian, median, mean and also about edge detection, boundaries, segmentation etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: professor is smart but can get easily boring. His voice makes me hard to pay attention to the class and because I am also taking another class that is similar to image processing, I know the material already and that makes me hard to focus in this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not too bad. If you do not make any mistake on homework, easily full mark. A small mistake can take off big points because each question has grading criteria. Even though your code runs appropriately, if you made a small mistake and had a wrong result, that will take off the whole point in that criteria, so make sure you double check your code and output.
three homework and final
reviews.comment_workload: not much of workload. He provides some code and we have to fill out rest of the code to run the image processing. Can be easily done. Homework isn't too hard. Didn't take the exam yet, so I do not know much about how exam will be like.

reviews.author: gossipgirl
reviews.comment_content: Content is okayish. Not that great, not very bad either. Some interesting stuff like face recognition, segmentation, edge detection, boundaries, skeletons, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Not that good. Lectures are pretty boring. However, what I actually didnt like about the course/teaching was that none of the assignments were related to any exam questions. All assignments were 90% coding.
It didn't really prepare me well for the exams.
No solutions of assignments/exams released. No past papers, very few sample questions discussed during the sem. Not a great experience altogether.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading isn't too bad.
Course mean 70% --> B

Assignments 30%     mean 26/30
Midterm 23%            mean 15/23
Final 47%                  mean 29/47
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much workload. 3 assignments + 2 exams
